Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Exdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March 2012. It is well situated just off La Rambla in the city centre and very close to the airport bus and tour bus termini. We thought that the public areas and our room were clean and well appointed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The sound insulation was disappointing, however, both between rooms and - despite the double glazing - to the street outside. We did not eat in the hotel. We hope to return to Barcelona and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona weekend”
Reviews.Author: bobholt
Reviews.Content: Here for El Classico the match to decide The championship. Hotel perfect for a weekend. Excellent full breakfast bar

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel with uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: rgs258
Reviews.Content: I imagine when this hotel was built it was a great place to stay. For my stay, the first room they gave me had closet doors that would not close and the room smelled strongly of perfume one might use to mask order. I returned to the lobby and rejected the room at which time they offered another room. The new room was smaller, also had doors with non-working hinges, and the paint on the all was chipping. As well, both rooms had old and uncomfortable beds. I continued to be displeased and informed the manager. I was then given a room on the top floor. This third room did have working doors and the bed was a little more modern. The room's main lighting did not work the first day, but it would appear that housekeeping identified and correct the problem as the lighting functioned the next day. As well, the shower was arranged in such a way that the entire bathroom was flooded when in use. Also, the third room had a balcony - it had moss all about it, had cigarette butts in the drain, and was overall poorly maintained. I do not recommend this hotel. The staff was very nice and accommodating - I wish that they may all see their hotel renovated or else transferred to a more accommodating hotel. Shame on Silken for running such an under-performing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bradburnryan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel from the 11th to the 15th April. Don't think it was worth the money we paid for it. Room standard. Walls like paper, could hear every flushing of toilet and conversation next door. Didn't eat in the hotel. Staff appeared to be friendly, on morning of our departure arranged for taxi from hotel to the airport for 12 in the afternoon. Reception said it was organised, so we went for a stroll. At 12 o clock a member of staff informed us that the Barcelona marathon was on and that no taxis could get into the area and that maybe we could wait until 12.30 maybe 1, like we were just going on a tour or something. Asked staff member was there anywhere we could meet the taxi? Surely staff should have been aware of this sooner you would think. Didn't direct us to any street, had no knowledge of this marathon taking place so I am assuming everyone else who booked taxis with the hotel were in the same position as us. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hotels I have experienced”
Reviews.Author: gerdw23
Reviews.Content: Hotel Silken Ramblas, 11 - 14 April, 2012 was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The only good features are the location and the size of the rooms. This may have been a 4* hotel once, but the entire stay was a total disappointment. Dark woods, bad lighting and worn carpets do not provide a welcome ambience. This ambience expands to the large rooms. The "air conditioning" cuts out when you select a temperature higher than 17ºC There are no plugs in the bathroom and subsequently no washing line. Overused towels with holes complete the picture. There is no noise insulation to the rooms around you nor the street below. Our sliding door could not be locked. The "free high speed internet" is a joke. The standard access code give you a 128 speed - remember dial-up?. After complaining, I got the business access. Even that was unusable in the room. You have to go to the lobby or sit under the router on you floor to get a connection at all. To take a book to give you something to do while the pages load. After this welcome we decided to not use the restaurant at all and went to one of the many excellent restaurants in the area. I will never use this hotel again and make sure that my clients will bypass this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Silken Ramblas for the second time with my husbands and some friends. The first time I was very impressed by the hotel, that's why I booked it for our second trip to Barcelona as well. The location is still GREAT, the staff in the reception is very helpfull and friendly. But this time we've got a darker room (window against a narrow autrium, a klaustrofobic feeling) and our room was connected to another room by just a thin door. In the connected room stayed a family of two or three small children who were running around in both the room and the corridor outside in the middle of the night. That was quite disturbing! But Barcelona is a wonderful city and our vacation was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona central hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsabelMeldrum
Reviews.Content: Persuaded my friend to come here for 4 night break rather than smart places away from the centre. Was right choice. Small but well designed room. Good bathroom and shower. Had fridge where we kept food for breakfast and snacks. Ramblas just around the corner but hotel very quiet at night. We walked everywhere. The longish walk to Parc Guell was totally absorbing with shops, Gaudi buildings cafes etc. Walk to waterfront great. Walk to Mont Juic not so great- take metro? Restaurants everywhere. Try Taller de Tapas (5 minutes walk) for dinner and Aitor (near Sagrada Familia) for great value lunch- or buy stuff in Boqueria Market or supermarket round the corner for a picnic. Didn't visit the pool- too cold! Finding the '@' on their computer was a pain - ask reception!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: EmiHil
Reviews.Content: Good location for all the sightseeing stuff, good comfy beds and clean throughout. But...the walls were paper thin meaning that you can hear everything that is next door and in the corridor. Not bad but wouldn't return due to the above and also because of the very menacing feel of La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: tuija
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here on my Barcelona break. The hotel met my expectations being clean, modern and comfortable. The room was facing a small alley off the street, so there was no view to speak. The bathroom was spotless, the towels however were not quite 4 star quality. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is on a small street just off La Rambla, and there are nice bars and restaurants nearby. Had a very pleasant tapas meal in a tiny tapas bar just opposite the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, offering to give us umbrellas for a day as it was pouring with rain as we set off for the day. The breakfast was very good, nice selection of food. Good coffee, fresh fruit juices, delicious fresh fruit. You can even have a glass of Cava with your breakfast if you wish. All in all, would recommend Silken Ramblas for a base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: caz3818
Reviews.Content: You could not wish for a better location for a hotel in Barcelona. The hotel is on a side street off La Ramblas which protects it from the constant hustle and bustle noise of the busiest area throughout the night. It is located towards the top of La Ramblas only a few minutes walk from Placa Catalunya where the tourist buses are stationed and also the buses for the airport transfers. Turn right on Ramblas and you are a minute away from the fabulous market, 5 minutes walk from the Column of Christopher Columbus and the marina and beach area. The hotel itself is modern in design and very clean. The buffet breakfast has a huge selection and you can go back as many times as you like. I would recommend paying a few pounds extra when booking for B&B rather than room only as I believe to pay for breakfast on the day is quite expensive. We didn't use the roof-top swimming pool as it was only about 20 degrees in March when we visited so probably a bit cold. Very nice facility though with sauna/steam room and gym too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay in this hotel again if visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: neweyHillingdon
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, room was big, everywhere spotlessly clean. Staff friendly and helpful and hotel in a great location, right in the heart of everything but away from any noise, would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting room”
Reviews.Author: FinlandMarsala
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine and good location,buffet breakfast expensive 18€, but we needed a small meeting"room" and they asked 150€ per hour !! so go to the roofterasse and keep your meeting there

Reviews.Title: “Good, until you get to your room...”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel are surprisingly generous. Yes, the location is good, the lobby area is glamorous and the small bar is fine for a couple of drinks (although with so many places close by to enjoy a drink, why would you?). Oh yes, there is free wi-fi too and the price is reasonable. So that's the good points. All of the points above are worthless though if you want a good night's sleep. The amount of noise that came into the room from the hall and other rooms was totally unacceptable. Conversations from the hall fully audible, toilets from other room flushing and in the case of the rooms by the lifts (our friends were unfortunate enough to have one of those) the noise of the lifts, plus the people talking in them. On top of this, I found the carpets the worst I have ever come across in a hotel of this supposed standard. In the interest of fairness, out of our group of six, two of us would never return, two were indifferent and two thought it was good enough to return.

Reviews.Title: “Group stay at Silken Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: DEPAK V Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights. During my stay here i found the staff at the reception very friendly and very helpful. the rooms where clean but we could not communicate with the cleaners. In the mornings we could people in the rooms next door and in the coridoor. Other than that the hotel was good value for money and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: sunflowerhanoi
Reviews.Content: - Unbeatable location, right in the heart of Barcelona, 01 minute walking to the famous La Ramblas. - Good breakfast and bar - Reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly nice little hotel on a great location”
Reviews.Author: buhalid
Reviews.Content: surprisingly nice little hotel on a great location just off the Ramblas 5 min walk from Plaza Catalunya where the blue airport bus stops comfortable rooms FREE working WIFI nice people very good value for money Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hoc01
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was extremely convenient in that it was right off La Rambla. It is about 6 blocks from the Liceau metro stop or about 4 blocks from the Catalunya metro stop. The yahoo map did not show it in the right place, so I wound up wandering the neighborhood for about 20 minutes, until I asked a local if he knew where it was. With the help of a little high school Spanish and a very friendly man, we finally found the place. It is on Pintor Fortuny, right across from the Parker Meridien hotel. The hotel looked quite nice from the lobby area. The room was clean and decent sized. Although they were not going to let me in until 2, they took pity on me after a 20-hour flight with little sleep, and when I told them that I did not care what kind of room I got (had booked 2 double beds), they let me have my room then (about 10:30 am). I got a single king bed. The other comments about the walls being thin are correct, but I was tired, and slept just fine. Hotel recommendation for a restaurant for dinner was spot on, and I had a very nice stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Location between many tourists spots and the tourist bus routes. Quiet location just off Ramblas but close to good restaurants. Very friendly and helpful staff. Cleaning of the room is very satisfying. Service and room service was excellant. WiFi not accessible in room but could receive it in reception area. The floor was not clean. Buffet breakfast good but pricey at 18.50 per head

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel superb location .”
Reviews.Author: Rosariobs
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to everywhere. Clean nice just a little outdated. Near the fabulous market. Get nav free on your iPhone it's brilliant and takes you everywhere. Go and eat down the called street st Joseph it's.cheaper. Amazing wine bar called la vinya del signor. Brilliant wine only fits 7 couples. Price is reasonable and you will pay 4 to 6 euros less for a bottle of wine. Loved barcelona. Men are a bit short though

Reviews.Title: “Will be back at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ciaranamow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! Plus, its downtown, but not in front of all the Hustle and Bustle. A 5euro cab ride will get you to the La Ramblas. You get free Wi-Fi everywhere in the building, which was awesome! The breakfast was delicious. You have to try the eggs! Fresh fruit! Crispy Bacon!! Mmmm

Reviews.Title: “So close yet so far away. Great spot in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJason
Reviews.Content: There are many things to see and do in Barcelona and the city is actually quite spread out. However, if you are a first-timer to the city, I suggest the Hotel Silken Rambla. You'd be hard pressed to find a better location. Literally steps from Las Ramblas yet you do achieve the feeling of seclusion back at the hotel. Another added benefit is that you're located just next door to Bar Lobo when you feel the need for some traditional spanish treats - tinto y olives. I last stayed during Le Merce which is one of the busiest times of the year in Barcelona and it was a great centralized landing destination.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was good, but room was a disapointment”
Reviews.Author: Vesku_S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 2nd floor room for 4 nights.Room carpets were old and did not look good. Also I did not wake up on my own clock ringing, but I heard the neighbour room alarm too well and that woke up on every morning, not ideal. Breakfat was good (part of the room price in my case) and wif-fi worked ok. Location if fine if you like to stay in the center.

Reviews.Title: “"Good location"”
Reviews.Author: kathcrowe
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Barcelona for a night after our mediterranean cruise. This was our latest of many stays in what is such a stunning city. We always choose to stay in different hotels and because we had my elderly parents with us who haven't visited the city for a number of years wanted somewhere central. What a good choice the hotel was, very impressive decor and the rooms were well furnished and quite large. The only complaint was that the rooms were very dark, we did ask reception if it was possible to have another lamp placed in the room and were told yes they would check the lighting. When we got back to the room after going out to eat, there was no extra light and we decided they probably hadn't understood the problem. If we had been there for more than one night we would have pursued the matter. All in all was very pleased with the hotel for everything else and would recommend it for anyone wanting a good hotel in a good location, just off the Ramblas and near Catalunya Square! The roof top terrace is well worth a visit after a day sightseeing to relax and have a dip in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Location-Location-Location”
Reviews.Author: Bimmer29
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and from what I'd read I was expecting a much smaller room. Our room was a comfortable size with a king bed, small seating area, large closets and a lovely five piece marble bathroom. The room was fairly dark primarily due to dark coloured wood paneling. The furnishings were very minimalistic but comfortable. The bed was comfortable however not the pillow top mattress that we expect in the US. Everything in the room was super clean. It definitely isn't the kind of luxury hotel we see at home but everything was clean and comfortable. The best part is the location. It's centrally located and is close to many attractions. It's only a half block from the famous Las Ramblas Street and about five blocks from the cruise ship terminal. There's a Starbucks just around the corner so you can have a taste of home for breakfast and skip the expensive breakfast in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: GunnerIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and were really pleased. The location is superb just a couple of minutes walk to La Rambla. Spotlessly clean rooms & spacious if a little dark. We had read lots of reviews saying that the walls were paper thin in the rooms but we did not have any problems with noise. We did not have breakfast as we felt at 17 euro it was way too expensive. Lots of places locally to get a good value breakfast. If you want a well located hotel with everything on the doorstep, clean and spacious rooms then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Clean and Spacious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5ummeruk
Reviews.Content: We were wary after booking this hotel after reading the reviews! So once we entered the hotel it smelt fantastic and was very clean. We agreed to check the room out before making a decision on whether to complain! However what we found was a spacious, clean, airy, nice smelling and a balcony! No complaints what so ever. The mini isn't that cold but does have some drinks in it for a price which is topped up daily. There is coffee and tea but no milk. The room was cleaned daily and fresh towels were left as well. This was done very efficiently and to an excellent standard. There is a supermarket just around the corner which you can buy all your daily goods from if you didn't want to eat out. We would purchase some lunch and drinks and eat on the roof terrace before sun bathing and going into the pool. The location is fabulous just off the main street of Las Ramblas and we found in the courtyard next door some lovely restaurants, the chinese restaurant is a must too also there is a Cocktail bar that opened as we were there which had deals on until 10pm! Taxi's are readily available and fairly cheap if you don't want to walk to the beach, waterfront or mountain! There are often many bars open for tapas and drinks with offers in the late evening. We did find that often people didn't go out until 8 / 9pm and the bars and clubs don't get busy until 1am. So we made good use of siesta :-) Would def stay here again if we visited Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SpainshFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Las Rambla but on a side street. Very handy for central rail and metro station and the famous market Bocaria. Our towels were changed daily and the room was spacious and clean. Tea and coffee was available ( you will need milk!) There is free wifi in the lounge and internet access if you wish to pay. We were able to do all the main sight by foot and then relax for a while around the rooftop pool before going out in the evening. All staff spoke english and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terrie S
Reviews.Content: Great location, but I'm not sure how this hotel got four stars. I tried to order a sandwich at the bar at 5.30pm but the kitchen is closed between 3.30 and 8.30! The only food available over this five hour period was a few crisps at the bar or whatever is in the mini-bar. We did not have breakfast in the hotel due to the very high price. There were plenty of places to get a good, reasonably priced breakfast nearby. Towels for use by the pool are available from reception for a 10 euro deposit. The pool area is not very nice. Several of the sunbeds were broken. My son woke up one morning to find water dripping from the ceiling. One night the telephone fell off the wall in our bathroom. The reception staff always appeared distracted. We thought the price was good for a four-star hotel and now we know why.

Reviews.Title: “Youthful, hip, and location”
Reviews.Author: stevenrph
Reviews.Content: The best part was the cleanliness, helpful, english speaking staff and great advise for hunting out our itinerary. They have a problem with "sewer" smelss throughout the day, but they may just be Barcelona. Did not have a great bar or a restaurant worth eating at but around the corner was 4 outside Tapas bars not on RAMBLAS street which we used everyday for our first drink-and tapas before setting out to walk the City. Do use this for a moment of rest or map viewing before going to or after your sites and before your 9 or 10PM dinner.

Reviews.Title: “in the centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: Carol0506
Reviews.Content: The hotel very modern and clean. The room was spacious and the bathroom was excellent. There was a free safe provided and the room was so dark that we had no idea whether it was day or night enabling us to sleep well and long. The hotel is close to all the main attractions, restaurants and bars as well as great shopping. Also, there were a few local supmarkets so that you can pick up snacks and drinks. The roof top patio with pool was a nice bonus, a great way to cool down at the end of the day. Plus there was a sauna too. Two negatives, there walls are quite thin, which is not too much of a problem except for the child who yelled and screamed for hours on end. These things happen. The other thing is the WiFi, which needs a code but the process is laborious and doesn't always work. A different code is needed for each electronic that you own. The front desk staff were very helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CDNtraveller66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located just off Las Ramblas and close to Playa Catalunya. We stayed there in 2 suites one night before a cruise. It was also close to many cafes, restaurants, and supermarkets. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Free Wifi. With so many places to eat close by we did not eat in the restaurant but did enjoy some drinks (from the supermarket) on the roof top patio. There was some noise from the streets into the early early morning but hey...its near Las Ramblas. If you are only planning on a 1 or 2 night stay its perfect. We felt very safe in the hotel and the nearby streets. Taxi to the cruise terminal was approx 25 E.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience, No worth money”
Reviews.Author: cfreeman21
Reviews.Content: This was the most disappointing hotel of our entire trip. There is nothing good about this hotel other than the location. The rooms smelled, it was dirty, there was no air conditioning, the door didn't lock. It was a nightmare. DON'T stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty & Shaby Room”
Reviews.Author: cypriotalien
Reviews.Content: More stains on the carpet than the pavement at Ramblas. Stay out of Room 406 if offered to you. After first night we moved to another room, more or less same situation with torn curtains, dirty carpet. The only thing keeping this hotel is its location I guess. This was my first visit to Barcelona as a "tourist" although have visited several times on business and stayed at other hotels at port olympic and the diagonal and think its not a bad idea on my next visit as a "tourist" to use one of those hotels as they are far superior and cheaper. As far as location is concerned a taxi is cheap and will take you anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dianaleeb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after 4 hectic days in Paris and before boarding our cruiseship. WAs pleasantly suprised by the newness of the hotel and the pool was a God-send. The first thing we did was to take a dip and refresh ourselves. Didn't stay there long enough to form a strong opinion but have the same comments as some others - porter was helpful, didn't bother with the overpriced breakfast, walls were paper-thin. We lucked out with a room with a juliet balcony overlooking a side street and some other residences/accomodations. Very picturesque. I Did find my neighbor smoking outside the window though! I'd probably try somewhere else for my next stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Only one good thing to say: good location”
Reviews.Author: ElaBizz
Reviews.Content: After changing room 4 times I finally gave up on finding a room which was good enough for a 4 stars. First room: horrible cigarette smell and filthy carpet. I asked to change room even if they insisted that it was a non-smoking room. Many people smoke from the balcony window but the smell is still there. Second room: it was like living in a cave. NO lights apart from the 2 small ones in the room, no decent bathroom lights...I had to ask a friend every morning if I looked like a clown with no way to see my face with make-up on!! Plus in bonus the plastic cheap hangers fell on the floor every time you put something on them. Third room: yes! Light and good hangers...again smoke smell and dirty carpet...so my last chance came from room 310 with YES light...Yes clean carpet...YES no smoke smell ! no hangers that were functionnal but at that point i just said f... It. I'm staying. I had breakfast once which was real good but too expensive considering the many options on the street. The rest of the time I just left to eat outside. Hotel next door the 1898 has an AMAZING terasse with a spectacular view of BCN! Also some excellent tapas at a good price considering it is a 5 star hotel. If you can avoid this hotel. Around the Ramblas there is the beautiful hotel Alicia at 160$ can that I found in the internet that was spectacular ! Just a few $ more than this fake 4 stars... Also be prepared to hear evrything your neighbors are doing...in the bathroom as well as in the room on the top floor and next to you...that sometimes can provide good entertainment!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, great location, noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: siboybradley
Reviews.Content: Set just of the main area of Barca, las ramblas and with several restaurants just around the hotel this is a great hotel for a city break. The hotel is really clean, nice rooms and good service the only down side is the noise coming from the corridors and between rooms. I stayed here on a city break with my parents and they said that their was a lot of noise in their room and in mine i could hear people coming out of the lift all night, and heard every word of the couple in the next room having an argument at 3am in the morning. Worth staying here if you are lucky with quiet neighbours as its a nice hotel and you couldnt get a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: leeds-fan-7
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Barcelona was part of a longer predominantly city based holiday so having at least one hotel with a pool, for us to have some 'chill out time' was key for us. The Silken Ramblas did not disappoint on that front or any other for that matter. It's location was ideal, we got private transport in but reaching it from Plaza Catalunya would have been easy. We were a family of 4 with 2 teenage daughters (16 & 19) and took a family room. It was only after arriving that I saw in the small print that this should only have applied to kids under 12, but it wasn't an issue. The room, with the girls sharing a sofa bed, was plenty big enough for the 4 of us. Would probably have been out of our price range otherwise! Breakfast was expensive but it's 5-10 minutes walk away from lots of places to get breakfast, we ate in the markets. The double bed in the room was huge and very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Not my best decision ...”
Reviews.Author: yuppietravels
Reviews.Content: I used the website where you choose a star rating and an area and then make a bid, without knowing what hotel you are bidding on. I asked for 4 star in Las Rambla area for $180. The Silken Hotel accepted my bid.Once we arrived we learned that our price should have seen us in a jr suite, instead we were given a room that on their own website is $60 less. The hotel looks like a 4 star upon arrival but I wouldn’t rate the room any more than a 3 star. It is clean, and the location of the hotel is wonderful. However the walls and windows seem paper thin. We could hear the man in the room next to us snoring clearly, and we felt terrible that the couple in the room on the other side had to be moved in the middle of the night as our 1 year old woke up at 3am (still not adjusted to the time change) and was noisy. If you are traveling with an infant- the Bjorn travel crib (which we have traveled with a ton and it is fabulous) fits in the room just fine, but a pack and play would not be able to be opened properly. The room is typically small for a european hotel and the beds and pillows are very firm. Granted, we had a 1 year old with us, so that makes a room smaller and I am pregnant, so hard beds are not a favorite at the moment. The bed was advertised as a king, but it is 2 singles- made up separately- pushed together. It didn’t bother us for just a two nights, but I suspect some couples wouldn’t like it. I can’t say I would recommend this hotel to a friend, particularly at $180 or if you have kids. For kids, the room is way too noisy for naps as there is scooters and construction going on and the pool is refreshing for a hot day, but too cold for little ones. Aside from that it just doesn’t meet 4 star standards in my opinion. That said, if you are not traveling with kids and you bring ear plugs, this is a clean stop in a perfect location! Also, a hot tip for parents, bring your umbrella stroller as the big ones would be very tough to get around in the crowds. The jump on, jump off bus tours are ideal with kids (or without) as you get to see the city and only get off when you need a walk or some eats. Lastly, if you are trying to change your timezone but fear you or your kids will get hungry at night, get groceries before you go to bed as the only thing open past 2 am is Burger king and they only serve fries and ice cream at that hour. (which I thought was great, but it was a terrible meal for my little guy)

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: marcel dam
Reviews.Content: Just feets from the ramblas, right in the hart of the city. Easy to get taxi's to and from, many good restaurants near. Helpful and friendly staff. Good place for those going on or off a cruise. we enjoyed the place. the one minus is that is not sound proof. Bar was also good as was the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: quist3000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Silken Rambla for 4 days, € 220 per night + breakfast. Room 205 needs a brush up. Dark, spotted carpet and torn out electrical plugs. Very noisy due to lack of noise protection. Wifi is for one device only, but wifi company offers additional access for one more device, but without access to mailbox. Super central position in center of Barca. Friendly service. Dark and depressive breakfast room. Breakfast good, but expensive, € 18.50 each person. Close by Los Lobo at nice Placa is worthy replacement. Too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel 100m from Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPilko
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via www.lastminute.com, surprised at how easy the process was compared to previous usage some time back, and delighted with the Silken at bargain price. Minor gripes - the hotel had not prepared our room, but they upgraded us to a suite for the ensuing wait. Nice decor in lobby/bar, with prices not as astronomical as expected, and there is an excellent and reasonably priced tapas bar/cafe opposite where we ate twice - food and service there both very good. Rooftop pool fine, views over the city. Suite comfortable, only niggle the safety mats on bath really abrasive - watch out for friction burns on the rear end!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pbrown_011
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip to Barcelona and we stayed at the Hotel Silken about a block off of the Rambla. It was very convenient to the local sites, easily accessible from the Placa Catalunya where the Aerobus stops to and from the airport and close to restaurants and the Carrefour. We had a small refrigerator where we stored some snacks and breakfast items, a water cooker to use to make both coffee and tea, a desk where my husband could work using the hotel internet and a small lounge chair and table for relaxing. The room was a good size and clean and comfortable. The staff was most helpful when we needed to print boarding passes as well as telling some other hotel guests that they needed to be quieter at 4am. My husband has stayed at this hotel before and we will stay there again. As an added note there is a small but nice swimming pool on the roof top deck. There are also lounge chairs, where you can relax and enjoy the incredible view of the old city and beyond. It is a great place to read, relax or just unwind from the day!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: dikiboy2000
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming staff and a fantatstic location. Only a two minute walk the Las Ramblas and five minutes to the Placa De Catalunya. There is a supermarket just around the corner if you want to buy drinks and snacks (to avoid the Mini Bar prices!). The rooms are compact and tidy and we would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted for our stay”
Reviews.Author: jwadd
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, helpful staff and a great location for most places. Perhaps a little noisy if you sleep with the window open - but then again it is a city centre hotel! Odd smell in the foyer, but we think it was cleaning product so can't really complain. Great price. All in all very happy with our choice which did everything we wanted it to do

Reviews.Title: “Good location, outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jorch67
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has very well location in quite quiet side street nearby famous Las Ramblas. Second floor room 201 was quite large but it was little bit outdated... Bed was 7ft/7ft (=large) and ok :-) Hotel breakfast was decent but pricy (17euros) You know, there is also better places near by to get your breakfast on your way to see nice Barcelonian places :-) If you don't want to use taxi from airport to hotel then terminus of Airport Bus 1 and 2 is about 200ft away in Placa Catalunya (Trip from hotel to BCN gate B24 took 52minutes!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely No Complaints! Got what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: SubhanNair
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel & will be staying there again. Nice warm & welcoming lobby (Perfect as it was winter time). Service was spot on, we had arrived early and was able to leave our baggage there. We had two rooms booked, although one was ready 30 minutes late but it didn't bother us as it may bother some people but thought I'd mention it. It was made up for by the reception staff when we had encountered a problem as we came to watch FC Barcelona play, we had paid for five & only received four. We mentioned it in passing to the reception guys and they went out of their way to help us out and basically sorted it which put us at ease & enjoy the time until the game. Both rooms were spotless and good range of toiletries were available. One room was a twin room with an extra bed which was a sofa bed but was extremely comfortable and was great that they had accommodated that. In terms of location, you can't beat it as it is off the the Ramblas which is the main tourist area and the most central you can get in Bracelona. Close to Catalunya metro station, less the 5 minute walk. Also, its nicely tucked off the road so it retains a quietness. Always found it nice to come in from the hustle and bustle of the Ramblas straight into the ambience and warmth of the hotel. All the guys were impressed and will be staying here again if in Barcelona & will be recommending to anyone thinking of coming.

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: elpidoushka
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this hotel during our 6 days trip with our 6 years old daughter. The hotel is conviniently placed, its clean and cosy. Breakfast a bit expensive but at the end worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Shame about the lack of Sound Proofing”
Reviews.Author: KIRSTY26
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a great location and very helpful staff. Lots of places close to the hotel for breakfast if you dont have it in the hotel. The rooms are meant to be sound proofed, but our room on the first floor you could hear the people talking in both rooms either side of ours in the morning and late at night, also when they used there shower too.

Reviews.Title: “4 star?? I don’t think so!”
Reviews.Author: CliveNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The one thing this hotel definitely has going for it is location – it’s perfect for the Ramblas, approx 50 metres away. The reception area is nice, as well as the bar area. The reception staff are friendly and helpful too. However, that’s the good part. On the first floor, the Mahogany veneer was peeling and chipped off the wood in the corridor. We asked for a double room, and were given a Twin room on first Floor (117) The room was very dim, dark and depressing. No light came in the window, and it had a view of a concrete wall a few feet away, which had been decorated with art work to make it more pleasing to the eye – with little or no effect. All the rooms on that side of the corridor will have the same view – so beware. (rooms 119 – 115, and subsequent corresponding floors above) The dark mahogany effect furniture only added to the gloom of the room. Two lamps didn’t work, and the socket for the kettle was faulty, so we had to boil the kettle on the floor, where there was a working socket. The mahogany wood effect cupboard was hanging off the front of the mini bar, it wouldn’t close. The walls of the room were “scuffed, ” marked and dirty, and needed painting – in no way are the rooms “Exquisitely decorated”, as stated in the hotel’s own literature (available from reception). In the bathroom, the lid of the bidet needed a clean, there was no bath or sink plug, and the shower screen was totally useless. It consisted of a mahogany style partition that only came up to shoulder height, and extended about a foot and a half from the wall. No matter how careful one was, the water from the shower (loads of it) went all over the floor every time, which we had to mop up ourselves. I called Reception to ask for an iron and ironing board. The hotel did not supply these; however I was informed that there was a laundry service, and you could have jeans and T-shirts ironed for 8 euros each! Apparently this is common practice, so I strongly recommend you take a travel iron wherever you go to. We requested a room change, but there were no other rooms available until the next day. Thankfully the helpful reception staff were able to move us the next afternoon. (Just as well. We hated the room so much that I was using the Hotel’s Internet facility to search for other hotels in the area. I was prepared to lose the money we had paid, and move somewhere else, regardless of the extra cost!) We were moved to room 114, further along the corridor. A much nicer room. With an adequate amount of light from the window (unfortunately still the dark mahogany furniture though!). The walls were not dirty and “scuffed” as before. It had a view of a narrow street outside, and a small balcony to sit on. The kettle socket worked, however, one of the table lamps did not. I reported it immediately, but nothing was done about it. The controls for the TV were slightly different in this room, and I couldn’t get it to work properly. One of the reception staff came to the room and gave a very helpful demonstration on how to operate the TV and change the programme language to English (sorry, but I cannot remember his name) for which I was grateful. So to summarise, first room horrible, second room acceptable. But no way should this hotel be classed as 4 stars. We didn’t eat in the hotel restaurant. No particular reason. I would recommend any of the restaurants in the area. Especially the pizza place about 50 metres up La Ramblas from end of the street (especially for the buffet breakfast), and none were, what I would class as, expensive. However I have to report that when we were going out one night, we were asked by one of the staff on reception, if we would “Like a woman sent to our room, as it is a service that I can provide”!! He was talking about a Prostitute!! At the time I thought this was amusing, but it is not what I expected from the hotel. With my employment, I stay in hotels all over the UK, so I am quite used to 4 stars. I think rating standards must drop when outside the UK. With regard to things to do in Barcelona Sagrada Familia (the cathedral by Goudi) is outstanding. Hire an audio guide for full appreciation. The hop on / off bus tours – very informative. Get on and off where you want. Glad we did them. Park Well (Goudi’s park), very good, but very steep climb to reach Cable cars (there are two different ones) one to the castle, and one to a terrace bar , with a breathtaking view of the city. Loved them both. Las Ramblas, picturesque, and the street entertainers are good.

Reviews.Title: “Good morning neighbours”
Reviews.Author: ReizendeRoel
Reviews.Content: Although the room itself was very spacious (seperate bedroom and sitting room), a connecting door allowed so much noise coming from the neighbouring bedroom that it was perfectly possible to follow their conversations and their bathroom habits. Not really necessary though...other than that, some issues with electricity; plugs which did not seem to work and a full black-out after I tried to plug in the water cooker. Location wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Even a 2 star would beat this!”
Reviews.Author: e_weir2
Reviews.Content: The first room allocated to us was actually occupied. Altho our cardkey worked there was a man in the bed which was very embarrassing. A porter was sent up to check our second allocated room, knocked before entering and announced proudly that this room was in fact empty! The only lamp in the room besides the bedside lights used the same socket as the kettle. However neither of these worked and the metal plate for covering the fuse box was msising. These faults were rectified quite quickly. There was no plug for the basin, the hairdryer didn't work, no matter where we plugged it into which fortunately I discovered before I washed my hair. When Reception phoned the room I discovered after saying hello two or three times that the handset wasn't actually attached to the phone!! We've renamed the hotel Fawlty Towers. If you do land up here refuse Room 422!! On the plus side the location is excellent. Sheila, Nov.2010

Reviews.Title: “a four star hotel with five star service”
Reviews.Author: Highlander03
Reviews.Content: My wifew and I thoroughly enjoyed our three nights in this hotel. The staff could not have been more helpful, the room was excellent, and quiet. The location is just off La Ramblas, this hotel was the perfect choice for us and I would highly recommend it. I look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with very good location.”
Reviews.Author: dphender
Reviews.Content: Good points of this hotel: the location (off la ramblas), the rooms (comfortable with nice modern bathrooms) and the staff at the reception (very friendly). I gave an average "value" mark based on advertised prices but we got a great deal on this as part of a travel package and were very happy with it...

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Cinquantasette
Reviews.Content: Good points of this hotel: the location, the breakfast and the staff at the reception (very friendly). Downsides: the walls are a bit thin and the furniture outdated. Perhaps not a four stars hotel, but good enough to spend a few days in Barcellona in a very central position.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location but falls short of a 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dre4mer26
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very modern and in great location. Walking distance to everything- Las Ramblas, Paza Catalunya where the bus and subway is located. Lots of shops, cafes, restaurants and the grocery store is just around the corner. We had asked for a non- smoking room but when we get there, the room and floor is clearly a smoking area. We had asked to be relocated to a non-smoking room and the staff were very friendly except for 1 who has a little attitude even though they say it with a smile. The internet didn't work for the 1st day we were there and the staff said that it doesn't work with Mac laptops! What!!!!??? obviously, he was making excuses or just not knowledgeable. The room gets cleaned except for vacuuming until the carpeting has visible dirt. Overall, we thought we were paying for a 4 star hotel but it felt a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget the pool upstairs”
Reviews.Author: robertguarnieri
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Clean, big rooms. Pool on the roof and super friendly staff. Breakfast is a ripoff as always, so go around the corner for better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Exploring_ss
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. If you're looking for a nice hotel, at a good location, with all the accomodations you need, this is it. It's a couple notches up from a basic/standard hotel but they really had great service. Our air conditioning went ou and they had it fixed right away. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The place is modern, clean and they have a great sounds sytem in the rooms - it's like surround sound that even has speakers in the bathroom; the music is pre-selected but good - loungy/trendy type music. Don't expect too much from the pool, it's on the roof and rather small but if you just need to catch a quick tan and take a dip it will serve its purpose. The location was great because it's right off of the center of Las Ramblas - the main area with shopping, restaurants, tourist information centers, etc. The only downside is this hotel had a business center that was supposed to give you free internet access but it was down the whole time we were there - apparently their technician never arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, good facilities, pretty good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DRNS-London
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, high quality rooms, pleasant staff but, above all, a superb location just 50 yards from La Rambla,

Reviews.Title: “Very decent. I would recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JennaDToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: The Silken was very good when compared to other hotels in Europe. The room was clean, had enough space, the bed was decent and came with amenities. Silken is off the main drag of La Ramblas, which was great because we didn't have to deal with any noise. It is also 5 minutes walk from the Placya de Catalunya and La Boqueria (market). Safe to walk through the side streets off La Ramblas to enjoy some decent restaurants. Careful everywhere you go though. Crime is horrible in Barcelona and we were pickpocketed but managed to catch the guy in the act. One of the locals we talked to said he was surprised that we didn't lose anything because crime is so common. We did get there early but were unable to get into the room until check in time, despite the front desk making an effort to get housekeeping to clean our room first so don't expect to check in early. The outdoor pool on the rooftop is small but if you have kids, it's a perfect way to entertain them for a bit while you relax. Never had a problem with hot water for showers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City, Hotel overall good, Room shocking”
Reviews.Author: ButtsCork
Reviews.Content: Entrance to the hotel, fantastic, room just very poor, didn't know whether it was day or night. A corner room looking out onto a court yard with a very small window hence no natural light. We were so disappointed with the room after requesting at nice room, non-smoking, the room smelt of cigarettes and we mentioned it to the hotel, they gave some feeble excuse. We could hear everything in the two adjoining rooms, we could hear them coughing, using the bathroom, etc., etc. Impossible to sleep any later than 9a.m. every morning between house-keeping calling to clean the room and hoovering the corridors. The only good thing about this is the room was cleaned and clean towels every morning. When we mentioned to the Receptionist about the room on check-out, we got absolutely no feedback, which was disappointing. Location of the hotel excellent, bar staff and house-keeping extremely friendly and helpful. Great to have a pool area in a city hotel, may not get a sunbed at first, but would get one at some stage of the day. Room and bathroom in need of a good revamp. I would recommend the hotel for location, pool, bar staff, but would also recommend when booking ask for a room either facing the street or The Ramblas, which as far as I could see have full windows and plenty of natual light.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning in top floor rooms!”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledFamily3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Barcelona trip... stayed at the Silken Ramblas, nice hotel, nice location just off of La Rambla...but we had NO air conditioning in our room! And it was sweltering hot!! We stayed on the top floor (can't remember if it was the 4th floor or 6th, but it was the top floor) and we got in late on the first night, so we just assumed that perhaps the ac was off all day, and it needed a while to cool the room off. Second day, we returned from sightseeing, and the room was still unbearably hot. Called down to front desk, and was told someone would be up to check on it. No one came, and after 11pm, we finally gave up and tried to go to sleep...but at 1:30am, we couldn't take it anymore, we called down to ask again. Finally an employee came up and explained that the top floor rooms had a problem with the ac, and nothing could be done except to open a window. We only had one more night before our cruise, so we sweated it out, taking cold showers during the night to help...but I would guess that the temperature in our room was close to 90 degrees! And opening the window didn't help...it was just as hot outside! It was such a shame, because otherwise it was a nice hotel... they should invest in a portable ac unit in those rooms if nothing else can be done to fix it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and extremely comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura2828
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my 15 year old daughter. We had a few teething problems with our room (lamp and one plug didn't work) but the hotel tried very hard to correct that, and even provided a plate of fruit to apologise. The location is brilliant - near enough but not right on top of La Ramblas and the fit out of the hotel rooms is of very high quality. We only ate breakfast in the hotel's restaurant once, and it was ok (nothing great). The front desk staff were extremely helpful in arranging/booking things for us. Of course our stay was enhanced by Spain winning the world cup while we were there - that only re-emphasised the great location of the hotel, as we enjoyed the madness of La Ramblas thereafter, but once we came back to the hotel you could not hear any sounds from the partying in the street. The swimming pool was fine - good number of chairs around it - but no shade really in the afternoon. All in all a really good hotel, amazingly comfortable beds (duvet/doonas were SOOOOOO comfy) and a good experience all round.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChuckC75
Reviews.Content: Silken Ramblas Barcelona is in a great location off Las Rambla, close to many venues and convenient to Metro and buses. A supermarket and food market were within 2 blocks as well. Room was comfortable, with good beds, TV and great dark shades for sleeping. Showers worked great too and had a safe to keep valuables, a good option in Barcelona. Staff we dealt with were helpful and friendly. Had small pool on the roof that was refreshing. The "gym" was the only negative - closet size with one machine and one barbell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pikagrass
Reviews.Content: Without seeing a bunch of other hotels in the area it is tough to be sure if this hotel is on par with the others in the area. I would certianly say this is a Three Star hotel and NOT a four star no matter how you slice it. It is in a great location for Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya and access to the Gothic area. There are three great restaraunts bars in a courtyard only meters from the hotel. The hotel itself is in need of a serious upgrade however. Rooms are very small, staff is very average, thought they did address most issues quickly. Bar is OK when you can find someone working it. Pool and deck are also OK but average.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jodonna1959
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel located perfectly, just a few steps away from the action on the Las Ramblas and a Starbucks right around the corner! The room was clean an the bed was extremely comfortable. Easy to get to the Magic Fountain via Metro as well as the Gaudi Church! Staff was friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DudeMcFood
Reviews.Content: More 3 star than 4 but a good location 1 minute off Las Ramblas and only a couple of minutes from Hard Rock Cafe, . Clean but rather tired looking hallways and rooms, could do with a refurb. Helpful staff and parking right underneath if you need it. Not cheap at 118 Euro a room and 24 Euro for 24 hours parking but Barcelona is expensive. ...Negatives...paper thin walls could here everything the neighbours said at both sides, our room 310 was looking out over a small street and we could hear everything that went on outside despite the double glazed door. The only thing that would stop me staying there again would be the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lack of response to missing item”
Reviews.Author: 1steffano
Reviews.Content: Terrific location! Room carpet could use some attention. I left my Kindle in the room after I checked out and called within a couple of hours to see if they found it. All lost, I suppose not too surprising. The puzzling part is the complete lack of response to multiple emails and phone calls. Simply no response by anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little find!”
Reviews.Author: ice-lemon82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my parents and it was an amazing hotel! Check in was swift and quick, location just of Las Ramblas, rooms clean, comfortable and spacious. My room was near to my parents room so no hanging about the lobby waiting or trekking to the other side of the hotel to meet up. Out quite early most days so did not sample the breakfast. Hotel is in good location for some tourist attractions and also handy for tourist open top bus. Restuarant good, and bar service great! All in all, fab hotel and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but dont expect a lie-in”
Reviews.Author: niamh6426
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Hotel Silken Ramblas in February with 5 of my friends. I have to say the location is superb, just 2 minute walk from the main street and 5 minutes from Placa De Catalunya where all the shops are!!!! After check in we went to our rooms which had 2 single beds (pushed together) and one camp bed which I volunteered to take. I have to say the camp bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom had a separate toilet room which was handy when us ladies were putting on our make up!! The shower was nice and powerful and the toiletries were plentiful. We did have to ask for two tooth brush sets as two of us were silly enough for forget them! The staff on the reception area were very friendly however the cleaners in the morning were running up and down the corridor and shouting from one end to the other which woke us up the three mornings we were there. The rooms were not soundproof whatsoever, we could hear the people when they went to the toilet and talking which was not overly pleasant either. There was a sauna and a roof pool however we did not try these out but we did go for a look! There are a couple of nice places to eat around the hotel, there is an oriental restaurant which is part of the hotel 1898 up the road, the food there was delicious and we went for breakfast in a restaurant on a corner just before the hotel 1898 which was delish also. The first night we arrived (late on a Friday) we went for tapas and then we retreated to the Meridian for some cocktails and cava. The Saturday we walk down Las Ramblas to Port Veil and has a lovely lunch. We then walked along the beach (it was a beautiful day) and then took a sky car which gave us great views of the city. That night we went to a restuarant called Pla which I would recommend (http://www.elpla.cat/) and on to a club. On the Sunday we took the bus tour which I would not recommend. Monday we spend the day shopping which I would highly recommend though no for your pocket!!!!! In all it was a great trip and I would go back to Barcelona however I'm not sure if I would pick this hotel again solely due to the noise factor.........

Reviews.Title: “Hen weekend - great value perfect loaction”
Reviews.Author: helenmariemelon
Reviews.Content: As a hotel for travelling with friends (hen weekend as I did) or partner I would recommend the hotel for its location being a quiet side street off Las Ramblas and also value for money. At just over £50 each per night I thought we got a lot of hotel for the money!

Reviews.Title: “PATHETIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: loz5340
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER call this a 4 star hotel. I would hear every toilet in the building flushing, every cough, every person snorring, every couple having sex. So much for sound proof rooms!!!! If you plan on sleeping, keep looking!!!! We stayed 3 nights, only managed to sleep during days! Only thing positive was that reception staff were very helpful and could speak english, but obviously they can't fix the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Hotel, Expensive Bar & Food”
Reviews.Author: Londonwhiteknight
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the hotel it was in a comfort room. The room was bright, clean and spacious with good facilities, although the coffee was never replace after the initial use. the walls of the rooms are thin and you do need earplugs if you are a light sleeper or have a room overlooking the road as the double glazing is very poor in insulating sound from outside. The hotel staff was friendly and all spoke English. There was little in the way of information in the room, there was no mention of the swimming pool or sauna or any information on checkout times or how to connect to Wi-Fi (When I enquired about internet access because I could not get access by Wi-Fi, the only information I was given by reception was that there was a guest computer at 2 Euros minimum use for 10 minutes which is quite a rip off as the hotel advertises free Wi-Fi on it’s web site.) The bar and breakfast prices were expensive when compared with other large city hotels (9.5 Euros for a single gin and tonic & the buffet breakfast was 18.50 Euros).

Reviews.Title: “definately value for money,quiet,clean,spacious,room with a view loved it.”
Reviews.Author: shawshank_9
Reviews.Content: Never been to barcelona before didn't know what to expect. Caught a bus from the airport to Plaza catulunya about 4euros, really easy dont shell out for taxi took 25 mins. Did not book hotel. when we got there we did not know were it was so asked at tourist information booth. They gave us a rough idea and we found it quite quick. We did not know what to expect read really good and bad reviews about it . Was pleasantly surprised staff friendly and spoke english asked for a room with a view paid £80 double room. Rom was clean, spacious and quiet had a bath and kettle. Bed was lovely had 2 really good nights sleep. Would highly rec. this hotel. We used the sauna had it all to ourselves it was looovely i even tried a dip in the pool but it was too cold. The pool is on the terrace, had some lovley views. This hotel is perfectly situated for a quick city break a few minutes walk from plaza catulunya and 20mins walk from the marina. Food is quite expensive now because of currency rate. Went to see fountains, but only swithched on weekends. Loved my holiday enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: amdromeda2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the internet for its location, which was excellent, very close to Las Ramblas. The hotel lobby was very nice, our room was not. Lots of things needed fixing, including the air- conditioning and the lock on the door. We came back to our room twice to find it unlocked- nothing missing. This hotel was very expensive for what we got. We stayed here for 3 nights, we found the pool on the last day which was lovely, Hotel needs more in house information in English about the hotel and the local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dont stay in a room next to the lift”
Reviews.Author: ozy_pair
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, the hotel foyer is nice. The room was clean and of good size but a little dated. If you get a room next to a lift ask to be moved straight away becasue they are very noisey. Dont bother having at the hotel bar because the prices are way to expensive. Have to use the free wifi at the hotel bar or mezzanine, cant use in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and perfect location; clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: ikke28
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 night at the Silken Ramblas Hotel. The good service started already before arrival. After my online booking, I first received the standard e-mail confirmation, but was also phoned that the booking was ok. First time ever I experienced this with a hotel. Also a welcome mail a few days before we arrived. We arrived early in the morning (10.15 am), but our room was already free to use. The room was bright, clean and had good beds, which is the most important for me in a hotel. Furtheron very good service of the staff. We didn't use the roof pool, but it looked nice and clean. There are several breakfast options varying in price, but we decided to have breakfast at a restaurant terrace (bar Lobo) around the corner. The location is perfect: about 100 mtrs of the Ramblas and nearby Plaza Catalunya. But still very quiet and noiseless. An ideal place to explore Barcelona. Defenitely a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gypseyroverCork
Reviews.Content: Myself , husband and another couple (our friends) are just back from a stay at the Silken Ramblas hotel in Barcelona. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are going to Barcelona. It issituated just off Las Ramblas and we found our Silken room spacious and clean and really dark at night which was great for getting to sleep. The one complaint I would have about this hotel is that the walls between each room is paper thin eventhough the hotel have sound proofed rooms advertised on their brochure and website. We were fortunate to have our friends staying at one side of us and people on the other side of us who were not too noisy. You could hear people talking, boiling the kettle, using the hairdryer, flushing the toilet etc. Our room had a large door opening out on to a side street with a tiny little balcony you could step out on. It had a kettle, mini bar, TV, radio and there was no problem eating in the room. The best thing about the hotel was the rooftop terrace and pool which was great in the evening after a busy day sight seeing. Just around the corner about two minutes walk was the Bocquara market which had every kind of food. We didnt have breakfast included as we found it very expensive at €18 per person per day. If anyone is going to Barcelona and looking for the name of a good restaurant be sure and find LA Fonda. It was excellent food and great value. We had two bottles of wine, four main courses and four desserts for around €67 and it was lovely food. But go early as the queues are very long each night to get a table. Be sure to go and see the waterfall display with music at the Plaza Despana about 5 stops on the metro from Plaza de Catlayna. It was excellent but hundreds of people there so very busy and its free. Be very careful on the metro as my friend narrowly escaped being robbed. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay at the Silken hotel and we loved the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Nothing bad to say.”
Reviews.Author: vanbc2009
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a whip around Europe with our three kids (17,13, 7). This was my favourite hotel of the ten we stayed in. Great location. Not just a minute from La Ramblas but even closer to great restaurants like Bar Lobo and a grocery store. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Rooms used space optimally, were clean, modern and comfortable. Rooftop pool was a great little oasis with plenty of recliners. Secure parking underground, good, reasonable room service. Booked through Priceline and no attitude from staff about it. Some hotels make a point of mentioning it and telling you what you aren't eligible to get and then show you to the worst room they have. Loved this place and would go out of my way to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the hotel rooms. The reception is so bright and modern compared to the dark, dull bedrooms.”
Reviews.Author: bloodyhubbard
Reviews.Content: It was the evening when we arrived at the hotel, we were given room 116, which was very disappointing as there was a smell of drains in the room and it was dark and dusty, one of the bedside lamps wasn't working, the kettle plug wasn't working and the ceiling in the bathroom was partially hanging down.The thought of staying 5 nights in this room was daunting. In the morning the smell was still there and it was still very dark in the room, with no light coming through the small window. We went to reception to complain and they were very co-operative and told us to pack our bags and leave them in the room and when we come back in from our day out our bags and belongings will be in another room. True to their word when we came back, we were given another room. This room was still on the 1st floor number 103 opposite the lift, this room was better, no smell and a lot brighter, .....but the walls were so thin and the neighbours so loud, we were kept awake. On a positive note - the location of the hotel is very good just a small walk to La Rambla, and the breakfast was excellent. We didn't use the pool, so I can't comment, we did go to the roof to have a look, all I can say is it looked ok, there were people in the pool and on the sun beds, but there wasn't any empty seats so we didn't stay. The public transport is so good in Barcelona, so we caught the bus to the excellent beaches. Plaça de Catalunya is a short distance from the hotel where you can catch the buses. When we go to Barcelona again, we won't be staying at this hotel. So I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: DenmarkIquack
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews after I had booked ( and paid) the hotel for 3 nights, made me slightly nervous. Turned out to be unjustified! From the moment of our arrival, the staff was helpful and very friendly. We ended up upgrading our room, as we wanted at terrace. The room was very nice and clean, a perfect place to relax after long days of walking the city. We had made reservations at some resturants from home - and forgot to bring the adresses. The frontdesk staff was more than helpful - they even managed to change our reservations for a later dinner ( not an easy thing) while we were out and about. We came home to a letter in our room - with our changed reservations, map of how to walk there and the menu , - printed from the internet. Ivan did this not once, but twice....... We did not eat at the hotel, but loved the pool, small but clean and adequate. I would not hesitate to stay at Silken Rambla again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel... old and dirty..”
Reviews.Author: elduderino1988
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations when I walked into the modern-looking lobby, but there was an unpleasant surprise when I walked out of the elevator and into the room: smelly hallway, dirty carpet in the room (including puke stain and smell), smelly pillows in the bed, dirty bed cover, sewer smell in the bathroom, pee stains on the toilet, dirty towels and the door in the bathroom was dirty/stained and was already shredded on the bottom. The lobby staff was friendly, but the room cleaning and room service staff was not. The breakfast selection was all right, but the food was not. The eggs were a light yellow and swimming in a pool of water, and the toaster they had was already building a pretty thick crust on it.. The table was still dirty when we were seated and the staff in the restaurant was unfriendly and unprofessional.. To top it off, when we walked in back from the Ramblas, there was a giant cockroach sitting on a wall in the lobby. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, as I will never set a foot in there again either.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: PRk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my husband and we loved staying there. We were upgraded to a suite as I emailed to explain it was my husband's birthday beforehand. We had two bathrooms, a Jacuzzi and a balcony all to ourselves, the bed was about 9ft wide, we loved every minute. The location is very central. We also ate at a fab restaurant called la Fonda which is a 10 mins walk, wonderful food and really cheap for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Old”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMomloves2travel
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed when a stepped out of the elevator, and then felt even worse when I walked into our room. This hotel is in desparate need of a complete make over. The hallways have an old musty smell, the carpet and walls are dirty. I would have not even bothered staying, if I would not have paid in full the non-refundable rate of $170.00 per night. Besdies the rooms being dirty, the hotel staff was rude and not helpful what-so-ever. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the fact that it is right off La Ramblas, other than that I have stayed at Red Roofs Inn and days Inn better than this hotel. As a matter of fact, a roadside motel is better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, wont recommend it to you.”
Reviews.Author: Ghafran
Reviews.Content: - Nothing special about this hotel - Staff cant speak English (if you need anything other than water and towels, you will have to make some serious effort in explaining what you need) - Not very welcoming staff at all, some of them got serious attitude problem aswel

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, unsafe, noisy, tatty dump”
Reviews.Author: Quentin1
Reviews.Content: This establishment is a filthy, tatty, noisy, unsafe dump, and most of the staff are inept and incompetent in the extreme. I presume that it was initially awarded four stars on the basis of its facilities, but amenities do not make a squalid, run-down hovel into a four-star hotel. Filthy. This hotel is very, very, very dirty. The carpets along the corridor and in my room were hideous – covered in huge and very unappetising stains and bits of debris left by the previous occupant (the room had clearly not been hoovered). These are floors you definitely do not want to put your bare feet on in case you catch something horrible, or in case your feet stick to the gunk on the carpet. The bathroom floor was covered in disgusting stains – particularly around the toilet (clearly dribbles of some previous occupant’s urine which had not been cleaned away). When I rubbed at these stains with tissue paper and soap, the paper came up black and filthy – obviously because the floor had never been properly cleaned. The bath had not been scrubbed, the shower screen and the back of the bathroom door were covered in splashes, drips, and dribbles, and the underside of the toilet seat and lid were covered in horrific yellow splashes – once again clearly reminders of the previous guest’s urinary habits. The small rubbish bin in the bathroom was still full of the previous occupant’s deposits; it is not pleasant to find somebody else’s used sanitary products and used condoms in your bathroom rubbish bin. Surfaces in the room – such as the t.v. base, along tops of switches, etc. – were coated in a fur of thick dust, and drawers in the desk and bedside table contained crumbs and a collection of varied bits of debris. The whole effect is one of ingrained filth and grime. Truly horrible. Tatty and rundown. Don’t be fooled by the reception area when you enter this hotel. Its cool white lines and ‘designer’ touches combine to furnish the guest with the belief that this is indeed a four-star hotel. The rest of the place, however, is tatty, tatty, tatty. Like a sad old apartment in which an ancient person has lived without doing any repairs or upgrading anything for the last thirty years of their life. Every single surface is scratched, corners are knocked off, panels of veneer are missing along corridors and in the room, the glass tops on the bedside tables are chipped, the ends of curtains are hanging off rails, lighting is broken (the bathroom light kept flickering on and off and the table lamp was broken), the mini-bar was not cold, the t.v. socket was hanging out of the wall, the bathroom looks like something from the 1970s – cold, dirty and functional, the shower screen is lower than the top location for the shower so water sprays out all over the bathroom… The list of decrepitude in this hotel is endless. And as for the sad little ‘swimming pool’ on the roof – it’s the size of a bath. The rooftop patio is as dirty as the rest of the hotel. Similarly, towels in the hotel bathroom are thin, hard, and stink of bleach (better, one must admit, than stinking of the previous guest’s urine, but still not one expects in what is supposed to be a four-star hotel). Noisy. The Silken chain has clearly never heard of soundproofing. The walls in this hotel are as thin as paper, and every single sound from the next-door room can be heard in full and glorious technicolour. That’s great if you want to hear every word your neighbours say during ‘phone conversations, if you want your room to shake to the rhythm of their music blasting away, or if you want to listen to every development in what appears to be the making of a cheap porn movie in the next room (not that I’ve ever viewed a porn film, but one can imagine that the soundtrack must be something similar to what I heard coming from the next room). If that’s not your scene, then stay far away from this ghastly hotel. Part of the problem, of course, is the hotel’s clientele. While this place sells itself on the Web as a cool, relaxing retreat for business people, it is in fact a very poor quality dive that seems to attract a poor quality clientele, and it is of course the clients who make the racket and who have no regard whatsoever for others in nearby rooms. If you get back to your hotel room at 3 a.m. it is not acceptable that you shout in the corridor or slam the door so hard that the entire building reverberate. That said, however, the hotel staff have no regard for peace and quiet, either. 8 a.m. and it’s your morning wake-up call in the form of the maid smashing her trolley out of her store cupboard. 4 p.m., the middle of siesta time, and you’re roused from your doze by the hotel’s handyman hammering three broken beds for an hour… Unsafe. This hotel goes to great lengths to advise guests to leave no valuables in their room, to close the door at all times (even when in the room), to take extreme care when checking out (so that bags and cases are not stolen from reception as you pay your bill), etc., etc. Altogether an unsafe place to stay. Staff. The staff at this hotel are in general a surly, ill-mannered, aggressive, useless, incompetent, and inept bunch (rare exceptions include Iván and Luis on reception, both of whom were extremely friendly and efficient). The very worst of this dreadful bunch were the two girls who worked the reception desk in the afternoon. One of them could barely speak Spanish, and neither of them had any idea whatsoever of customer service. Just for the record, it doesn’t include making eternal excuses to guests. The number one rule in customer services is this: your client doesn’t want excuses; he or she wants solutions and results. The two girls on reception made no effort whatsoever to resolve the multiple problems arising from the filthy, rundown nature of the hotel in which they work. They were rude in the extreme. They were also more than incompetent, and past masters in the art of the feeble excuse. One can only assume that there is such a dearth of people who want reception work in Barcelona that the Silken Ramblas is obliged to employ whatever turns up on its doorstep (probably sleeping in a cardboard box outside the front door when they open up in the morning...). General. Despite its Web description suggesting that this hotel is suited to the business traveller who will find within its walls a calm place to relax after a hard day’s work, this establishment appears to be used almost exclusively by raucous tourists who have no consideration for others. Staff are rude and useless and make no effort to assist guests. If you are indeed a business traveller, do not make the serious error of staying here. Look for a real business-class hotel somewhere away from the centre of the city – an establishment that will be clean, quiet, will provide free Internet access (the Silken Ramblas has wifi, but guests have to pay for Internet access if they don’t have their laptop with them), and where staff will be attentive to your needs. If you’re a noisy, no-frills tourist who wants to be in the centre of Barcelona, then you can surely find somewhere that is as filthy, rundown, tatty, unsafe and generally shoddy as this place for far less money. In fact, this hostelry is such a doss-house that the Silken chain should pay guests for having to put up with its awfulness. Problems with this hotel are also exacerbated by the absence of any management whatsoever during holiday periods. I stayed here during the St. John’s day holiday, and the hotel’s manageress was away on leave.
