There was thus nobody in charge to take important decisions or to deal with the multitudinous guest problems that arose. This blatant lack of concern for actually running and managing the hotel pretty much sums up Silken’s attitude: get ‘em in through the door, grab their cash, and provide an inferior product; after all, who cares about tourists? – there are plenty more where this lot came from. Avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Location Plus!”
Reviews.Author: Mozza47
Reviews.Content: The Silken Ramblas is just 30 paces off Las Ramblas on a safe bright side street. The parking is directly below the hotel, and the garage entry looks as flash as the lobby entrance, which is why I missed it! Once more around the block ;-) Service was outstanding, all 3 front desk staff I dealt with were very helpful and with enough English to accommodate all my requests! The lovely old barman is a delight! Downsides are very, very noisy rooms because of paper-thin walls (to the fellow in the room next door last Saturday night, they have some excellent flatulence control potions these day, try them!); and the free WiFi is inconsistent, at times it's good (I guess when there's no-one else online) to hopelessly slow. Don't rely on using the likes of Skype here.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ltjbukem73
Reviews.Content: stayed there for one night. the walls are paper thin. for a four star hotel not to have european/us converters doesnt' make sense to me. it's in a decent location if you like being close to las ramblas. the rooms are darkly spec'd out, from the dark mahogany built in cabinets/shelves to the dark marble baths. seems a bit outdated. rooftop deck/pool is fairly nice but no great views to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location, modern, clean, big & comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: nessie421
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Silken Ramblas and highly recommend this hotel. Positives: * great location, just off La Rambla, easy walking distance to Metro * modern and clean * front desk staff was polite and helpful * big and very comfy bed. This was a surprise as most beds in European hotels are queen or even full-sized. The bed here was king-sized and very comfortable. * tea and coffee set in room. Usually I don't care, but I had a horrible sore throat and the tea helped * great water pressure in shower * variety of toiletries in cute containers * good value * it was too cold for the pool, but I went and looked at it and it looked nice. NEGATIVES * noise from the street, but I think you'll get that from any hotel near La Rambla * A/C not on in March. It was unseasonably hot and the room was stuffy, but if we opened the windows it was incredibly loud * I went and looked at the "gym" - it's a bike, incline bench with one set of small weights, and a table. Not impressive. Overall, this was a very good hotel and we would stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: dubtipp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in October 2008. Unfortunately, there was torrential rain for the couple of days we visited so spent alot more time than we planned on in the hotel room. This wasn't the pleasurable experience we'd hoped for. Firstly, the location of the hotel, off the "top" end of La Ramblas (el corte ingles end) is fantastic. Right in the centre of everything. The buffet breakfast is really great, with a good choice of everything and topped up regularly. The breakfast room staff were most pleasant too. Unfortunately, the reception staff aren't from the same charm school. As a previous reviewer said, we were also left standing at reception while they had a private chat and did some computer work. In the finish, we did the polite cough trick. The room, in my opinion, wasn't at all nice. It's exactly as the photographs depict it, but is really dark and horrible in reality. Our room also looked out at a wall. Granted there was art work of sorts on the wall - I don't know if it is official art or just graffiti - but it wasn't a pleasant site. The bathroom was smaller than our downstairs loo at home. The shower (in bath) was powerful though so I didn't really have any complaints about that. The bathroom door opened against the bath, making the room very confined. The bed was very comfy though on a positive note and very clean. We didn't take a look at the gym or pool so won't comment on them. The lobby bar is typical hotel bar - a few people sitting around but no atmosphere. There's a really nice restaurant about two doors from the hotel, towards La Ramblas which is really nice and I'd recommend it. Unfortunately, I can't remember the name of it. There's also a Carrefour directly across from the hotel which is very handy for water etc. In summary, the location is great, the hotel is ok - clean but the dark room at the back of the building didn't inspire me to go back. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Definitely not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: janetsplanet
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Barcelona and we wanted a nice hotel to relax in that was convenient for the sights. On arrival the lobby was clean and impressive but the room was a big disappointment. It was a good size but the door from the corridor practically opened onto our bed, the walls were badly scuffed, the window onto the balcony didn't shut properly, the bathroom needed a good scrub, it had clear plastic ceiling tiles that were cracked and dirty, the hairdryer was heavy and didn't work properly. The bed was a good size but as mentioned before it had 2 single quilts. The only English speaking channels were CNN or CNBC, no pay to view channels so was practically useless. On the whole the room was very disappointing. We did have internet connection but the signal was "low connectivity" or from time to time it would disconnect. Because it was raining and cold we didn't use the roof top pool, the fitness centre was very small with just 3 pieces of equipment. The sauna was next to this but a flight of stairs from a shower or the pool. It was noisy which you expect in a city centre but because the window didn't shut properly it was worse than usual. Thankfully we got the hotel for a good price and it was in an excellent location within walking distance for a lot sights, plenty of shops and restaurants plus a Carrefour Express over the road for anything you need. On the whole disappointed with the hotel. I thought if we chose a four star hotel then we'd be safe with the cleanliness and standard of the room. I've stayed in Holiday Inn Expresses for half the price with cleaner and better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: prehim
Reviews.Content: We booked this flight and hotel deal with Expedia and got a very good deal. Upon arrival to the ramblas via metro, it was buzzing from the word go! We had taken time finding a hotel that was close to the ramblas and was decent enough , and this hotel lived up to all expectations. It is a two minute walk to La Ramblas, but quiet enough to be away from the constant activity on La Ramblas. Our room was lovely and spacious - a pretty and clean. I would definitely recommend Hotel Silken Ramblas to travellers visiting Barcelona, , good for location, eating and shopping and most of all close to metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so good room or hospitality”
Reviews.Author: wexgal1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the internet after checking with tripadvisor and found the location excellent, just a short walk from the main street on La Ramblas. We arrived at the hotel having booked a standard room with a ipod walking tour of the city. On arriving at the hotel we found our room very small and a hugh wall right at the window. I am a bit claustiphobic so aked if we could be relocated to another room so had to pay an extra 10 euros so our room cost 110 euros without breakfast which was a bit steep. There was a kettle in the room but no milk and when we asked for some we were told we could go to the bar and get some. The room was ok a bit small and no views only onto roofs, it was clean and had nice toiletaries.The staff were not very helful as we this was our first time to the city, the ipod wasnt a great help as it was just a running commentary on the sights so we were a bit disapointed with this hotel after reading the reviews and feel it was not good value for money. There was no atmosphere in the bar area and the staff seemed to like to chat and leave u waiting at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeGirly
Reviews.Content: As we walked onto Pintor Fortuny, we passed the very posh Hotel 1898 on our left and the even posher Le Meridien on our right, before approaching our hotel, Silken Ramblas (apparently also known as Ambassador Hotel). Pleasantly surprised, the hotel looked exactly how the web photos portrayed it; modern and simple with an above average and somewhat superior feel to it. Parts of the hotel is constructed in line with Barcelona's famous architectural heritage which was nice to see. The rooms were sizeable with a flatscreen TV and powerful hairdryer. Our air conditioning and fridge did not work however, although our friends' did work fine. Be warned that they do not have an iron and ironing board available for customers, and if you need something ironed you have to ask housekeeping to do it - apparently it is their policy for safety reasons, but at around 10 Euros a pop, I'm not so sure! The best thing about the room was undoubtedly the larger than average double bed which was extremely comfortable and spacious for two! The bathroom was not top notch, but was modern and clean. The shower was not the newest of showers, but the shower head was great. The hotel bar was small and arranged in an open plan area but offered quite a good range of and cocktails which were about 7-9 Euros per cocktail, and very well made. Location was fab - literally just 1 minute from the Ramblas. Overall a very nice hotel and very reasonably priced - I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay at Silken Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: meggy22
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the Silken Ramblas Hotel for five days during November while sightseeing in Barcelona. It is perfectly located, just off the Ramblas, a short walk down a typical Barcelona street (not seedy and another reviewer stated) with a few nice cafes and restaurants, there is a great chinese restaurant at the end of pintor fortuny st, near the rambals, look for the dragon. We booked our stay through last minute.com and everything whent smoothly with the booking. The hotel was very nice and was well worth the £250 (inc flights) for the four nights that we stayed there. The main reception rooms were very smart, clean and modern (beautiful bar area) and the staff all spoke good English and were very helpful and polite. We had a twin bedded room which over looked the main street, which was not noisy. The room was modern, clean and comfortable with comfy beds, LCD T.V, and mini bar (which had plenty of room for our own drinks, instead of paying mini bar prices). The bathroom was a reasonable size, with marble walls and floors and was cleaned every day, as was the main room. While staying in Barcelona the 10am tour of the liceu opera theater was great (you get to see the private members club on this tour) as was walking around the ramblas food market and of course the Casa Battlo, Casa Mila and the Sagraga Familia, You will get Gaudi overload.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto scratch”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Big-Cat
Reviews.Content: The only thing about this hotel that was 4 star or above standard was the price and the lobby. The bad: Doors to rooms are hang poorly and over sized therefor they do not close properly. Found this out firstly by leaning on the door next to my room and falling into the room while somebody was sleeping in their bed. Embarrassing. Had to double check every time we left and went to sleep because it required a massive amount of force to close the doors. Room finishing was poor. Looked like someone was shot to death inside our room near the door, it had several holes, cracks, paint chips in the 'entrance hall'. Everything felt cheap. Gym. Well if you can call it a Gym. You need more than a one bench and a combined total of 18kgs of weights to call it a gym I think. Found the room to be effected by outside noise even though out 'balcony' only looked out onto an alleyway which was too small for cars to go down. The good: Pool area on roof is very nice. Would be great in the summer. Plenty of places to relax up there. However pool isn't heated so its wasted in the off season. Wifi is free in your room and it works well. Location is great. Just off Ramblas, near everything you want to be near.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible Silken Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: BarcaLover1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a week at the Hotel Silken Ramblas through Easyjet (previously the Ambassador Hotel), stating on the booking we requred a room with disabled facilities. We had taken a significant time finding a hotel that was accessible for disabled travellers, and this hotel lived up to all expectations. It is situated in Calle Pinctor Fortuny, literally a two minute walk to La Ramblas, but quiet enough to be away from the constant activity on La Ramblas. The staff at Silken Ramblas were very helpful and polite throughout our weeks' stay. They booked taxis for us, assisted me in pushing my husbands wheelchair up and down the (rather slippery) slope within the hotel. The room was lovely and spacious - a very roomy bathroom with grabrails - the only problem was, that the flooring is extremely slippery when wet as it appeared to be made of marble. Other than that, everything was lovely. Crisp, clean sheets every day and nice, thick towels. There is a hefty room safe available for belongings. I would definitely recommend Hotel Silken Ramblas to travellers visiting Barcelona, due to the high quality of the hotel (4*), helpful staff, and great location. As we were travelling on a budget (of sorts!!), we did not use the hotel restaurant as it appeared very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality Service, Not 4 Star for sure...”
Reviews.Author: Aubert1979
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel for several reasons: 1) They say there is a gym even though there is no gym (its a room with a bench from the 80s) - this annoyed me as it was a reason for my choosing this hotel in the first place. 2) The internet station at the hotel assuming u have no laptop costs 2 euros for 5 minutes, clearly not something a 4 star hotel would charge customers...but they do. 3) Cleaner left my door wide open after cleaning, and I returned to find it that way - ie no staff realized this between the time the cleaning ended, the door was prop'd open and I returned...again on the housekeeping front, never replaced things we drank from mini bar had to ask them all the time....ie water...we never had any. 4) Staff speak little or no English, or a mix of little and poor English. Manager generally speaks very bad English, but surprisingly managed to be argumentative all the same. Impressive, I thought. 5) Only positive is the location, close to Ramblas and Gothic Quarter - having said this, my girlfriend and I enjoyed watching some dude shoot heroin in the back alley (where the balcony looks out to) - so if you're with young kids/kids period, maybe not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelledTheWorld33
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, in the most convenient place you can stay if you want to be in the heart of things. Its literally 2 minute walk from La Ramblas. it will take you approx 10-15 minutes to get to the Marina. There are lots of restaurants around the hotel, but try and find one in the side streets they are much better. The only downside was i was expecting the pool to be bigger, but its on the roof so what did i expect??

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mopsydopsy
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great staff, great comfy beds, great air con, great pool, great room service. brilliant location. you honestly can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: SammyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Looking for hotel to stay in Barcelona, we stopped outside Hotel Silken thinking it would be very pricey, but went in anyway. Was 100 euro for the night which seemed quite reasonable as the Hotel next door was 123 euro for night. It was an oasis in a very hot City. Efficient and great attention at desk, modern and refreshing. Rooms were beautifully appointed, great decor. Probably one of the nicest Hotels we had stayed in for a while. Loved the airconditioning. It is close to the main street in Barcelona and we walked everywhere from there. There is also a supermarket close by, bakeries and restaurants. A great spot. It was good walking around in the heat knowing you were going back to this cool and great room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Convenient,Chose it for the Pool”
Reviews.Author: dtiwine
Reviews.Content: Having been to Barcelona before and having stayed at the Royal Hotel on the Ramblas we again wanted a good standard of hotel, that was reasonably priced, and convenient . Would have gone back to the Royal but this time wanted a pool as one of the reasons for the 4 day break was to get away from the rain and to relax. Hotel very convenient - clean and functional - like a lot of city hotels, not a lot of people in the bar area at night as atmosphere too good out in the streets. Room was nice but very dark due to the proximity of the next building so there was no view - you had to practically strain to see what the weather was like outside - and because the room was dark we slept in most mornings. Didnt eat at all in the hotel as there was a large selection of street cafes etc and breakfast was too expensive in the hotel. The rooftop pool was small but very welcoming - the only thing was that there was only 10 sunbeds available - however it wasnt too busy and there was a good supply of seats/tables. Bathrooms were okay in that the toiletries were plentiful and very good - although shower was above the bath, and there is no natural light. Beds huge and comfortable, bedlinen pristine,plasma tv, good music system. Noise levels from bedrooms above annoying with a child who never stopped crying from early morning and parents who seemed to continually speak as if they were shouting. Would I go back? - if the swimming pool/convenience was important yes - if swimming pool not important would put the Royal Ramblas above it because of its bright rooms/open airy breakfast dining room and good value breakfast - 10Euro as opposed to 17 euro) Very nice bar behind the 1898 hotel called bar lobo. Two excellent restaurants 'The Attic' just opposite the 1898 hotel in La Ramlas - there is a rooftop terrace if you want to eat outside, and Sinatra restaurant - unfortunately cannot remember the street name - but if you go to the large courtyard of restaurants on further down the left hand side of the Ramblas and take the alley out the back of it you will find it - well worth a visit - collect one of the fliers of the staff who are advertising it and you get a free glass of cava. The taglietta is perfect - it is sirloin of veal cooked medium to perfection - the Passion fruit dessert is really lovely. We took the tourist buses for two days - 20 euro for 1 day, 26 euro for two days - used it to go to the beach on one of the days. The Nou Camp - Barcelonas home ground is well worth a visit - we went to a match, and whilst I am not into football the stadium is really impressive - we took the metro which was convenient and cheap. Being late home from the match did show a different side to the late night streets - there were a lot of undesirables about - so much nicer to go out early and come back at a reasonable time. In saying that barcelona definately rates very highly as a place to visit - for history, shopping, beach, sunshine, food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning in The Silken Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: LeChefCymru
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I, Mrs LeChefCymru took our honeymoon at this Hotel in Barcelona. All I can say is what a very modern cool hotel, well situated, just off La Rambla in a small side street literally 150m from Placa de Catalunya. This was perfect as we took the Aerobus directly from the airport straight to Placa de Catalunya and we just had a very short walk with our cases. Anyway back to the hotel, the reception was very modern in dark woods and marble and led straight into the lobby bar. We didn't use that because of the abundance of bars in Barcelona but it looked nice all the same, just a little quiet. The reception staff were freindly and professional. We had a standard room which was air conditioned, had a large bed, sofa, TV, dressing area and good bath/shower. The room was immaculate and again very contemporary. A nice touch to my mind was the constant 'chillout' music available if you should so wish. Also, the room was toward the rear of the hotel so we did not get much of the street noise. On the roof was a nice terrace with great views and a compact swimming pool, you could order drinks from the bar if you wanted via a telephone. There is a gym but this was very limited to one bench with a light barbell and a stationery bike. We did not take breakfast at the Hotel as there was a good little cafe in the adjacent square which did a nice bocadillo. We did not eat in the hotel at all as there are plenty of good eateries in Barcelona, most of which you will find in the narrow side streets off La Rambla. All in all a fantastic honeymoon complimented by a good quality hotel in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Silken”
Reviews.Author: spurs10Kerry_Ireland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay in the Silken, the location is ideal, very close to the centre of Ramblas but not too close that it became noisy. Ideal for touring the City as it is close to the Metro, close to the shops and restaurants, and is most of all a nice Hotel. The room was lovely and spacious and the bathroom was lovely as it had both a bath and bidet, the bath was a real bonus after a day's touring I was delighted that it didn't just have a shower. The air conditioning was great and there was a TV but mostly spanish channels or American News, but it was still nice to have the facility. There was a sauna and pool but we didn't have time to use any of these facilities, the pool is on the roof and there is a lovely view from up there, but the weather was quite cool in May so we didn't use it. The Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed for five nights, we didn't eat in the Hotel at all as there were so many choices of restaurants in the City. It was so reasonable to eat out, and we were so glad to be within walking distance of everything in the evenings as touring all day could prove very tiring, and heading out on the metro at night again would not be appealing. Ideal Hotel for a City break and Barcelona has so much to offer. Very accommodating too when we had an evening flight, the porter took our bags for the day so we could spend the day in the City before heading for the Airport. There is no problem getting to the Airport, the shuttle bus leaves every six minutes from the nearby square, the porter will give directions and it only costs about 10 euro or less for two people. So no need to spend a fortune on a taxi if you have loads of time to get to the Airport. We did get a taxi on arrival as we arrived in on an evening flight, cost about thirty euro but worth it to get to the Hotel door. So I would definitely recommend a stay at the Silken.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good fares bad location wonderful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lapiera
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for a sailing regatta and our boat was full of people when me and my family decided to sleep away. We asked to the travel agent of the Barcelona Yacht Club and they found this nice hotel just near the Ramblas. Unfortunately the Ramblas is very crowded and during the night around the hotel there are a lot of drunks. When You enter the hotel You feel the change. Inside it is another world, all clean and confortable, there is even a small swimming pool and a sauna on the roof. Clerks are kind and rooms are clean, big enough and confortable. Beds are well done in the morning but when we asked to have clean laundry for the bathroom they forgot to bring it to the room. Price is very low because for 2 adults and 2 children we paid only 200,00 euros for one night. I suggest the hotel for families with children. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Silken Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: FRQTFLYR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Silken Ramblas in Barcelona for 7 nights in one of the Silken Rooms. I found this hotel through a search again and I was impressed with the hotel's website. The hotel was very modern, chic, and contemporary. Check in at the hotel was very easy. The front desk staff were very helpful and after spending 7 nights at the hotel, you got to know most of the front desk staff after walking by them several times a day. We had a King size bed in our room. This was a real king size bed by North American standards and not two twin/double beds stuck together like they do in many European hotels. The bed was extremely comfortable with nice clean sheets, deep rich colours and lots of pillows. The room was very spacious and extremely clean. We had desk, sofa with pull out bed, recliner and cocktail table in our room. The coolest part of the room was the built-in music system. At the flick of a switch you could listen to some house/jazz music throughout the room, including the bathroom and shower!! Pretty cool. The bathroom was huge...marble countertops and flooring. There's also a bidet in the bathroom which I thought was funny. Again, a fairly common thing to have in Europe. The only thing that was a bit of a drag is that there was no shower door/curtain in the bathroom. The shower/tub has half a wall covering it and then the rest of the space is all open concept. Sometimes water would splash onto the floor of the bathroom while you showered...but these types of showers seem to be quite common in Europe. The hotel had a small business centre with a computer for internet access. There was also a small lounge/bar area just after the main lobby which was pretty hip and stylish. The waterfall feature was a nice touch as well. We never did eat the hotel. There are tons of cafes/restaurants all around the hotel and Ramblas. Across the street from the hotel is a small restaurant serving typical Catalunyan dishes and tapas. There's a small grocery store around the corner as well as a Starbucks. The boquiera marketplace is 2 min from the hotel where you can all sorts of different foods. Looking forward to my return trip to Barcelona...and I will defintely stay at the Silken Ramblas again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it, will use it again both for business and tourist trips”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very conveniently situated both for wandering up and down La Ramblas, and for the Gothic quarter. On a small side street just off the main road, near several other hotels, this was a great find. It's just up from the big market (Bocaria), and probably 10 mins walk from the sea-front. Just far enough off the main road that the noise was reduced to a bearable level - didn't need my earplugs for once. The hotel looked new, maybe it had just been refurbished, but everything was clean and shiny. Reception was fast and efficient. The porters were a bit overbearing, and eventually I just took my own luggage up, but it wasn't a problem. The bar was quite nice, it would be a nice place to meet people before going out to explore. Lifts were fine. Corridors a bit dark. Room excellent, but they all smelt of smoke, even the non-smoking ones. Not badly, just enough to make to want to open the windows a bit when you came in. Not an enormous room, but OK. Bed was huge, clean and very comfortable, with chocs on the pillows. Bathroom was new looking. Desk was more than big enough to get some work done. The wireless internet is free, and you need to get a password from reception. But it was a reasonable speed and the connection was good. There was a room safe, which was worked by another key card, and a mini-bar with a good selection of soft drinks and beer. Reception staff were good at ordering taxis, alarm calls etc, and were very polite even at 2am. No breakfast, we went to a coffee/pastry shop down the road instead. All in all, an excellent hotel for business travellers, but I'd also use it next time I go to Barcelona to visit friends.

Reviews.Title: “ideally located”
Reviews.Author: D_WilkinsonCarlisle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Silken Ramblas for 3 nights in March 08, for a birthday celebration. Ideally located for The Ramblas with many great restaurants in the surrounding streets.Rooms very spacious, bathroom very nice,and well maintained during our stay. Bar service very good,perhaps a little pricey,but ok for drink after a long day sight-seeing. Staff polite and very helpful. Our only complaint would be that the rooms are not very sound-proofed and we had particularly noisy neighbours who returned to their room very late,very drunk and very noisily every night ! (not the hotels fault I know),We did not eat in the hotel ,as the choices close by were vast,so can not comment on this . Overall, a good hotel and probably worth what we paid around ,£100 per night,.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TiburonTony
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel based on the reviews of other Silken hotels, recommendations of the chain by other travel Web sites and the description of the Silken chain philosophy. Initial impressions are good; on a quiet side street just off La Rambla and about 100 meters from Placa Catlalunya and with a contemporary though not cold reception area. Just down from Reception is a small lounge area containing a small but seemingly fully stocked bar and at the end of the lounge an impressive water feature. Check-in was painless, however the room we had been allocated was a twin room even though I had booked a room with a King bed. A quick call to Reception resulted in a change of rooms, but we had to wait an hour for it to be cleaned (we had arrived early so we had already waited an hour for the first room, not the Hotel’s fault and we didn’t mind). Returning after lunch there was no luggage in the room, another call to Reception and they insisted it had to be there; no it isn’t. Finally a receptionist came up and asked if we would help them look in the luggage area; they were still on the baggage cart from the first room effort. Again the initial impression of the rooms is favorable; dark wood veneer, a generous sized room (even by American hotel standards) and the standard bathroom with granite sink top and wall tiles. Closer inspection reveals shabbiness: badly scuffed walls, scratches and chips on doors and door frames – one bedroom door (not ours) had a large chunk of veneer missing. There was a medium sized work desk part of which was occupied by a television with poor reception and one English language channel - the CNN channel was in Spanish – and with only a single electrical outlet, in addition to the one for the desk lamp. There was complimentary Hotel WiFi in the room which was basically useless with minimal to no signal. I had better luck parking on a nearby open network. One had to go down to the bar area to get a useable signal. The bathroom was a modest though acceptable size with a sink and tub containing a wall shower and a toilet and bidet. Caveat: this arrangement may be disconcerting for anyone who likes their privacy when using the toilet, both the toilet and bidet are behind a partition with an open doorway (no door) to the sink and tub area. The King bed turned out to be a puzzling matter. It was two twins pushed together and a pad across both of them. Not terribly unusual but why they couldn’t have done that with the original room isn’t clear. Furthermore it transpired that they presumably didn’t have duvets for a King size bed, they used two duvets for twin beds with one overlapping the other as one does for roof tiles; not very comfortable down the seam where one ended. The biggest disappointment was the handling of the fire alarms, which activated at 5 AM on our first night. The emergency stairs emptied into a storage room in darkness and the exit doors were barred with a crossbar. Neither of these turned out to be major but in an actual fire could have slowed the exit sufficient to incur unnecessary casualties. In addition the behavior of the night staff at reception (after we walked all around the outside) was less than inspiring. They were totally uncommunicative as to the cause of the alarm and as to what was being done in evaluate the situation. They had turned it off and simply continued with their work, refusing to answer any questions. A comment to the front desk manager later that morning solicited a weak apology and a shrug. The bedroom walls are thin, for two nights we were awoken by our neighbors coming in at around 4:30 and proceeding to argue violently for almost two hours. I recently stayed at the Ayer Hotel Caspe and my observation is that that hotel is better for someone on business (a much bigger work area, complimentary wired broadband, and WiFi, and a view out of the window while sitting at the desk), also the room safe at Ayer Hotel Caspe will hold a laptop, whereas the Silken Ramblas will not. Given its location, the Silken Ramblas is a better choice for a tourist. I don’t think it’s a four star quality hotel but at a discounted rate it is decent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly 4-star”
Reviews.Author: Austin-1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. True, the location is very convenient to the central shopping district and the staff are mostly courteous. But, they seem to have only one person on reception and one on bell duty at any given time, including prime check-in/check-out times. it is a very noisy hotel -- do NOT get a room in the upper 20s. Not only will you hear every flush your neighbor makes but also a tremendous amount of street noise. I have no idea how this hotel secured a 4-star rating. Some of the lack of amenities in the $450/night junior suite in which I stayed: No ironing board No pants hangers Very few tissues (a small package of 4) A 1"x1" bar of soap No face washcloths One English channel on TV No alarm clock No secured Wi-Fi and have to get new username/pswd each day

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Demir
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel, I stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights just before christmas. The hotels location is perfect, just of las Ramblas on the same road as some of the luxury hotel (meridien, 1886- or something like that). Its a great base for anyone wishing to expore Barca. The hotel itself was modern, clean and had a nice bathroom (an important feature for me). There is some mystery surrounding the gym and sauna which didnt seem to be open, though we did not raise the issue with reception. Our time was far better spent sipping on cava (we snuck in from the local supermarket). All in all i reccommend this hotel to anyone, a great value hotel! Adios

Reviews.Title: “Last Mintue Booking”
Reviews.Author: Irishchelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nites in August 07, was a last minute decision to go a short break. Stayed in the Ambassador Hotel in Barcelona, on a side street off The Ramblas. Hotel is situtated in a great location, the streets have so much to see with markets and entertainers lining them, u wont feel the 5min walk to the harbour. Temperatures were in high 20's but walking along the median of the ramblas which is lined with trees kept us cool. The hotel was lovely n clean and hotel staff were friendly. Room were large with large bed and mini fridge. Bathroom was also clean and large and lots of things provided, shampoo, showergel, toothpaste, even a sewing kit and shoe polishing kit! Will definetely be returning here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jamesyp1976
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my girlfriends 30th birthday, she has stayed there before so she knew how good it was. Set 30 seconds walk from Las Ramblas (THE place to stay in Barca) it was a modern hotel with a very contemporary room. The roof terrace was a reasonable size and the pool - which is quite small, but average size for Barcelona - was nice to dip in as the temperature was 30C+ everyday. About 15 minutes walk to the beach, which you won't notice as there's so much going on everywhere. Or you can walk to the harbour (5 mins) and get a cable car to the beach which was 9 euros. Close to Hard Rock Cafe (which as a fussy eater was a god-send as I don't like fish) and close to the gothic quarter which is amazing to walk through with all it's alleys that lead to bustling squares and varied shops. Get on the open-top tour bus which goes all the time and you can get on or off as you please and goes to all the main attractions. Did the tour of the Nou Camp which was amazing. Only other thing i'd say is get the Aerobus from the airport which cost about 4 euros each and go all the time and stop outside Hard Rock, saving yourself a fortune in taxis. Great hotel, location and city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: koshoc
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Ambassador for 4 nights in mid August 2007. Having got a great discount via "easy to book.com" Excellent swimming pool, excellent room(although view from room was crap!) but room was cleaned daily,towels changed daily. I would definately return to this Hotel. Hear are the only downsides... Rooms are noisy(can hear people going to loo above you) Breakfast is way way too pricey, however that was a blessing for us, because directly opposite is a tapas bar that serve many things for breakfast, and at reasonable prices. I feel if the hotel didn't charge that very high price for breckie, then more would stay in for it, I didnt see any person tacking breakfast at hotel. Nonetheless, we were very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Service”
Reviews.Author: torontocruzer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It was a little dark, but was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again on my next visit and am surprised at any negative comments. Jodi from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: triothree
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was a great disappointment. They made and extra charge on my credit card for over $160 without my authorization, claiming I made a reservation and never showed up. And this is after I spent over $600 on my 4 night stay. My credit card company advised me to contact the merchant (the hotel) but they gave me a runaround for weeks. In the meantime the the period for complaint with credit card company expired so I ended up paying the $160. Stay away from these thieves. Feel free to contact me about details at my email address: triothree at yahoo dot com

Reviews.Title: “4* Location,but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: Eurotrippers3
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from this 'hotel'.We had booked for 10 days,but left after 6.This is not a 4* Hotel. The rooms are not sound proof,but are filthy. The gym was never available & from what we could see there are only a few machines in it. On opening our window we were treated to a view of a residential block,they werent happy to see us either. The ownership of this hotel changed early July,and while all blame cannot be aimed at them - they were not respondant to our complaints. The staff were friendly,excellant location.I understand the hotel is to be refurbed,so maybe next Summer it will be up to 4* Quality.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel; Great location”
Reviews.Author: txtravel021
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel in a great location! The rooms were dark....more lights needed! The hotel is next to an apartment complex, so when you open your curtains you are literally looking into someone else's home. This made us uncomfortable, so we kept the curtains shut for the most part. The staff was very helpful and gave us excellent dinner recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: sallySomerset
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Barcelona and were VERY dissapointed with the Ambassador. It has a 4 star rating, but does not match other Hotels of the same star. Our room was not ready when we arrived, and we sat in the lobby bar, but no one knew how to make a coctail from the Hotel list. I requested an ironing board when I was unpacking, and they said that the Hotel does not have any. I had to ask 4 times for more coat hangers. There was no tea or coffee facilities in the room, and our room was VERY VERY dark. At night we were woken by people coming in, the toilet of other rooms, and coversation from other rooms. I hated every minute of being in the Hotel, and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfall in Lobby!”
Reviews.Author: N.Sher.
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed in The Ambassador Hotel for a night in the middle of December. It is in an excellent location, just aff The Rambla. We started the shopping day early and were able to return on foot several times to drop off packages. We had requested a smoking room and were orginally booked into the 1st floor which is entirely non smoking. But there was no problem, we asked reception and were immediately given a room on a smoking floor. The rooms were spotless and the people at reception were lovely. We could hear the TV from next door but not enough to disturb sleep. The room we were given overlooked a street at the back of the hotel and was very noisy in the early evening but no disturbance at night. There is a large wall type fountain/waterfall in the bar/lobby which is interesting. We really enjoyed the time we spent here.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, spacious rooms and excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Alba2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ambassador for 11 nights and had a fantastic holiday- Barcelona exceeded my expectations. The staff were great, really polite and helpful, the facilities were fab for such a central location - the pool was perfect for cooling off in but it was not built to swim legnths in... Our room was very spacious, one room for sleeping in and another for chilling and relaxing in (the rooms did differ in size throughout the hotel) Breakfast was included with my stay and the spread was never ending... Hotel was the icing on the cake for a wonderful holiday - I will definatly return to both Barcelona and the Ambassador!! 10/10..

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Overlooker
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after another hotel lost our reservations. The city hotels were filled for a sporting event and we were walking down La Rambla going from hotel to hotel. We saw some hotels down a side street and ended up at the Ambassador. They had one room left--a two-room suite that they gave us for what I thought was a song. It was a corner room overlooking a picturesque side street and though a busy street, the soundproofing was excellent. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. We had a king-size bed while our daughter had a twin in the next room. There was also free wireless internet service. The buffet breakfast was included in the price and was adequate. We had no other meals there as there are many restuarants two blocks away on La Rambla. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel also had English language newspapers. When checking in the clerk said that the hotel garage cost $20/day. That was in line with what I've paid in big U.S. cities, so it wasn't any shock. The nearby public garage would have been a little more for a 24-hour period. When I checked out, I didn't see a parking charge on the bill. I mentioned it and they said forget it, they weren't going to charge anything. We never tried the rooftop pool, but the views of the city were interesting. I'd stay here again if I could get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Stonetraveller
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Barcelona, so no real idea of where we needed to stay. However by luck more than judgement we found that the Ambassador was for us a perfect location. Just off La Ramblas and a short walk away from Place Catalunya, which was ideal for catching the aerobus to and from Barcelona airport. The Hotel was clean, fairly modern and the staff were freindly. We had a room overlooking the small street above the entrance to the hotel, so could be a little noisy, but if you are in the middle of a city I guess that's normal. Loved Barcelona and the hotel made a perfect place from which to explore a great city. If we went back I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel In Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Lofty from Kent
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed here for 4 days while on a stag weekend (we wanted a better standard hotel than the rest of our party because we were there for a few extra days!). We didn't experience any unwanted noise others have mentioned - this may have been because our room overlooked some kind of ventilation shaft, which while it made our room very dark, kept it quiet. It's very well run, good helpful staff, immaculately clean and tidy, and a lot bigger on the inside than it looks from the outside (like Dr Who's Tardis). It took a minute to Las ramblas which is where the main tourist part is. Our only complaint was the swimming pool was out of action, and although on arrival there was a sign saying it was closed for 2 days for cleaning, it was closed all 4 days we were there, and the sign was still up when we left! Other than that, I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel. However, be very very careful around Las Ramblas, particularly late at night. In our short time there we experienced first hand, 3 pick pocketings, (two wallets and a mobile phone). Also late at night it, walking back to the hotel we were approached nearly every 30 seconds by prostitutes and drug dealers, which was not a pleasant experience, and because of the pick pocketings we spent the whole weekend actually made us all feel quite unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got a great deal with breakfast included ( Excellent and varied ). The best location in town!!,next to las Ramblas minus the noise. Rooms lacked sound proofing, yes, but we were so tired from exploring the city every night, that we fell sleep very quickly and didn't mind the noisy neighbors. The rooms were a bit dark, but the amennities ( toilettries, mini bar) and cleanliness were excellent. The staff was polite and helpful. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and cant wait to go back to this exciting and wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: zg
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights; great location, helpful staff, nice rooms, very nice buffet bkfst (little pricey)but got woken up every night by people snoring in the adjoining rooms !! not exagerating, the walls must be paper thin, you can hear everything that goes on in the next door room, its a real shame just for this reason alone would never go back or recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: MIDLETON
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 glorious days in this wonderful City. The hotel is in an excellent quiet location and the rooms are very pleasant and spotless at all times. The only down side was the noise between rooms - there is no soundproofing whatsover. We could hear people snorning in the next room, talking and doors closing it was like they were in our room !! it was so clear. It is an awful pity as the hotel despite this is excellent but i wouldnt recommend it because of the noise levels and lack of any form of soundproofing. Lovely breakfast included and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because was recommended by our family that stayed there 3 yrs ago. It is in a quiet street next to Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya, a perfect location outside from the noise, but close enough when you want to be in the middle of Las Ramblas. Rooms are very dark but a very good size in comparisson to other hotels in Barcelona, staff is nice, breakfast is very good and have a lot of variety. We had dinner one night, food and service was very good. Also the lobby bar is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: Sun Seeker 1949
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The location was excellent. The furnishings in the room were a bit dark and dreary. The first night was quiet but the room next door was occupied the second night, and we could hear every noise. We couldn't go to sleep until they switched their TV off. On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and helpful.
